headline.print_headline: Break Up the Banks? Bad Idea
headline.main: Don’t Break Up the Banks. They’re Not Our Real Problem.

snippet: A protagonist of “The Big Short” argues that the attention paid to the banks distracts us from the real economic challenge we face: income inequality.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Steve Eisman disagrees with many American who believe large banks continue to pose threat to economic system, citing his 25-year career as portfolio manager and financial services analyst; explains roots of financial crisis, why he believes big banks do not present systemic risk and why breaking them up could be harmful to America's economy.
